answers.answer: I take methotrexate which is a chemo. medicine. I was taking 8 pills every Wednesday but I had to bump it up to a stronger amount only available in injections. Tomorrow will be my third week of giving myself the shots. THe next day I am even more tired than usual and somewhat nauseated - these are the only side effects I am havng so far.  I also take prednisone and plaquenil for my lupus.I was diagnosed in 1990. I know how frustrating it can be - especially when people don't understand because you don't "look sick". Are you seeing a rheumatologist? I pray you can get some relief from your symptoms.  Take care. B.

Yes, I have been on chemo for years. I take 150mg Imuran daily and 250mg chloroquine ( I was on hydroxychloroquine for 6 years before switching to chloroquine).  The chemo (Imuran) made me very nauseous for the first several months but after I got adjusted then it only bothered me during the hot summer months if I was riding in a car.  I have been on the Imuran for 9 years and for the most part it has worked great for me.  I'm still always tired but the rashes, skin problems went away and the joint pains became bearable.

I am reading your comments with great interest.  I have Lupus (finally diagnosed in 2004) and am also diabetic.  I also have severe gastroparesis due to the Diabetes and am currently awaiting approval for a gastric pacemaker implant, but the surgeon is very concerned about my immune system due to the fact that I am on Prednisone.  I have been on the steroid since my diagnosis and although we have tried weaning me off of it, I can not function without it.  I have had pericarditis three times in the past year due to the Lupus and the treatment for that is prednisone so its been a losing battle.  I have a picc line in right now and can only take a liquid diet and all IV meds because of the gastroparesis.  I was put on Plaquenil as well in the very early stages of my diagnosis and was taken off of it (don't remember why).  Does anyone know if the Plaquenil is less debilitating to the immune system and the ability for the body to heal?  I have also been told that Cytoxan may be used in the future.  Does anyone out there have any information on Cytoxan??  I'd be interested in hearing more about the Imuran also. Any information you can give me I would appreciate.  I am going to see my doctor next week and it would be nice to go armed with some information.  Thanks and everyone please take care!!

question: My memory problems are getting worse.  They increased my hydroxychloroquin to 600 mg a day.  I just seem to continue declining.  Some days I am so tired that I can barely stay awake at work.  I also have multiple lymph node chains and my skin itches so much I could use a wire brush on it.  I wonder if the docs are missing something and if they just attribute everything to Lupus.  I sure hope they don't mess around and let me die or something.Have any of you had Chemo to treat your Lupus?MJ
